data.enText: the process or result of being destroyed by natural causes or by not being cared for (= of decaying)

data.chText: 房东不管，房子已经破烂不堪。
data.enText: The landlord had let the building fall into decay .

data.chText: 城市上空弥漫着死亡和腐烂的气息。
data.enText: The smell of death and decay hung over the town.

data.chText: （社会、机构、制度等的）衰败，衰退，衰落
data.enText: the gradual destruction of a society, an institution, a system, etc.

data.chText: 经济衰退；道德败坏；城市衰落

data.enText: the decay of the old industries
to be destroyed gradually by natural processes; to destroy sth in this way
if a building or an area decays , its condition slowly becomes worse
to become less powerful and lose influence over people, society, etc.

simple_means.memory_skill: de 向下 + cay 落下；降临 → 向下掉 → 衰退

ex.chText: 气候潮湿，水果都霉烂了。
ex.enText: The dampness of the climate caused the fruits to decay.

ex.chText: 由于不注意保护牙齿，我长了两颗蛀牙。
ex.enText: Two of my teeth decayed from lack of care.

ex.chText: 这些建筑被听任破败下去。
ex.enText: These buildings were left to decay.
The Roman Empire began to decay.

synonyms.bx: 指（使）某物逐渐腐烂或建筑、地区等破败、衰坏；也可用于抽象概念，表示衰败、衰落。

ex.chText: 那条死鱼在树下慢慢腐烂。
ex.enText: The dead fish laid putrefying under that tree.

ex.chText: 尸体已经腐烂得辨认不出来了。
ex.enText: The body had putrefied beyond recognition.

synonyms.bx: 指死去的动植物腐烂，常会产生毒气和臭味。

ex.chText: 连绵的雨会使木头烂掉。
ex.enText: The continued rain will rot the wood.

ex.chText: 政府只是让那些失业者靠领取救济金颓废度日。
ex.enText: The government simply left the unemployed to rot on the dole.

synonyms.bx: 主要指由于自然变化而分解、腐烂，可有臭味也可没有臭味，引申则指人颓废、萎靡不振。

tr: as of stored charge or current
the process of gradually becoming inferior
the spontaneous disintegration of a radioactive substance along with the emission of ionizing radiation
an inferior state resulting from the process of decaying
example: the corpse was in an advanced state of decay
the house had fallen into a serious state of decay and disrepair
The unoccupied house started to decay

tr: lose a stored charge, magnetic flux, or current
example: the particles disintegrated during the nuclear fission process
The body started to decay and needed to be cremated

value.def: When something such as a dead body, a dead plant, or a tooth decays, it is gradually destroyed by a natural process.

example.ex: The bodies buried in the fine ash slowly decayed...
example.tran: 埋在灰烬里的尸体慢慢地腐烂了。

example.ex: The ground was scattered with decaying leaves.
When not removed, plaque causes tooth decay and gum disease.
example.tran: 牙斑如果不清除就会导致牙齿蛀蚀和牙龈疾病。

value.tran: (尸体或死去的植物）腐烂，腐朽，腐败;(牙齿）遭蛀蚀

value.def: If something such as a society, system, or institution decays, it gradually becomes weaker or its condition gets worse.

example.ex: Popular cinema seems to have decayed...
example.tran: 大众电影似乎已经衰落了。

example.ex: Congress has tried dozens of approaches to revitalize decaying urban and rural areas.
example.tran: 国会已试行过数十种方法来重振正在走向衰败的城乡地区。

example.ex: There are problems of urban decay and gang violence.
example.tran: 存在城市衰败和帮派暴力的问题。

value.tran: (社会、制度、机构等）衰败，衰退，衰落

trans: 衰变期；衰减（变落）时间；缩写词为DT

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to fall, to drop, to fall down 落下；降临
rootsaffixes.title: cad, cas, cid, cay

partsOfSpeech.dec: cad 落下；降临 + ence 表行为 → 落下的〔声音〕→ 声音的抑扬
casc〔= cas〕落下；降临 + ade 表动作的结果 →〔水〕落下 → 小瀑布
cas 落下；降临 + ual 有…性质的 →〔没有准备〕降临的 → 偶然的
cas 落下；降临 + ual 有…性质的 + ty 表情况 →〔突然〕降临 → 事故
co 共同 + in 使… + cid 落下；降临 + e → 使一同降临 → 巧合
de 向下 + cad 落下；降临 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 向下堕落的 → 颓废的
de 向下 + cay 落下；降临 → 向下掉 → 衰退
de 加强 + cid 落下；降临 + uous …的 →〔树叶、表皮〕落下 → 落叶的；脱落的
in 使… + cid 落下；降临 + ent 表名词 → 使〔突然〕降临 → 偶然事件
oc 加强 + cas 落下；降临 + ion 表动作 → 使…降临 → 发生
oc 加强 + cid 落下；降临 + ent 表名词 →〔太阳〕落下的地方 → 西方
